Tokoroa Police seek information on Four Square burglary https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/news/tokoroa-police-seek-information-on-four-square-burglary/6POCTYJCKFGGBGC6TVGQI6I5HM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/news/tokoroa-police-seek-information-on-four-square-burglary/6POCTYJCKFGGBGC6TVGQI6I5HM/ Police have asked the man or anyone who knows him to contact them. Wed, 24 Apr 2024 01:25:51 +0000 Tokoroa police would like to speak to this man, who may be able to assist with enquiries into the burglary of a Tokoroa shop on Sunday.
Two people charged after incomplete pipe bomb found at Christchurch homehttps://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/two-people-charged-after-incomplete-pipe-bomb-found-at-christchurch-home/XDSBHISNJVBEFFDGSSWYBPV3DU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/two-people-charged-after-incomplete-pipe-bomb-found-at-christchurch-home/XDSBHISNJVBEFFDGSSWYBPV3DU/ Pierre NixonTwo people have been charged with unlawful possession of an improvised explosive device. Wed, 24 Apr 2024 01:24:05 +0000 Christchurch Police have charged two people after discovering an incomplete pipe bomb during a search warrant yesterday. Photo / George Heard
Watch: Meet ‘Patchy’ - the homeless entrepreneur selling coffee from a trolley https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/watch-meet-patchy-the-homeless-entrepreneur- sell-coffee-from-a-trolley/4VWWQLLM2VFGPHLAQ2HX4VHCNU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/watch-meet-patchy-the-homeless-entrepreneur- sell-coffee-from-a-trolley/4VWWQLLM2VFGPHLAQ2HX4VHCNU/ Corey Fleming'Patchy's Coffee' has proven a hit on the streets of Auckland. Wed, 24 Apr 2024 01:08:18 +0000 Homeless Aucklander Jon Low - better known as 'Patchy' - has moved into a new retail space to build his coffee business. Photo / Corey Fleming
Kāinga Ora spending nearly $150m on new and revamped state houses in Northland https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/kainga-ora-spending-nearly-150m-on-new-and-revamped-state-houses-in-northland/D2CRUWOSBRD2NNLME2I6TENOSM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/kainga-ora-spending-nearly-150m-on-new-and-revamped-state-houses-in-northland/D2CRUWOSBRD2NNLME2I6TENOSM/ Denise PiperThe state house owner plans to build nearly 400 new houses by the end of 2025. Wed, 24 Apr 2024 01:00:00 +0000 Kāinga Ora has a $150m-a-year build plan under way for housing in Northland, such as these two-storey homes currently being built on Churchill St in Kensington. Photo / Denise Piper
Hamilton cars stolen at a rate of six a day https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/news/hamilton-cars-stolen-at-a-rate-of-six-a-day/BGNPBY7R6BABXLXFMKMLOWAJ3U/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/news/hamilton-cars-stolen-at-a-rate-of-six-a-day/BGNPBY7R6BABXLXFMKMLOWAJ3U/ Maryana GarciaThe number equates to an average of six cars per day. Wed, 24 Apr 2024 00:41:38 +0000 An average of six cars per day were stolen in Hamilton.
Investigation finds source of rat foot found in toddler’s mouth when eating Pak’n Save precooked garlic bread https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/te-awamutu-rat-foot-found-in-toddlers-mouth-when-eating-pakn-save-precooked-garlic-bread-from-home/PUOKK6KINZACVBN2FGWDRJKT5I/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/te-awamutu-rat-foot-found-in-toddlers-mouth-when-eating-pakn-save-precooked-garlic-bread-from-home/PUOKK6KINZACVBN2FGWDRJKT5I/ Kirsty WynnAn investigation found that the rodent's foot was raw and not in bread when purchased. Wed, 24 Apr 2024 00:22:28 +0000 Forensic analysis by New Zealand Food Safety found the foot was raw and could not have come from the pre-cooked garlic bread. Photo / supplied
Anzac Day 2024: From Gallipoli to Gaza: remembering the Anzacs not as a ‘coming of age’ tale but as a lesson for the future https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/anzac-day-2024-from-gallipoli-to-gaza-remembering-the-anzacs-not-as-a-coming-of-age-tale-but-作为未来的一课/LX5PCC6CZNAUDFEZKONAQJKSHM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/anzac-day-2024-from-gallipoli-to-gaza-remembering-the-anzacs-not-as-a-coming-of-age-tale-but-作为未来的一课/LX5PCC6CZNAUDFEZKONAQJKSHM/ Olli Hellmann, University of WaikatoCOMMENT: Anzac Day marks a defining event for our national identity. Wed, 24 Apr 2024 00:22:08 +0000 At Gallipoli, New Zealanders discovered something important about our identity and began to think more of ourselves as part of a separate nation to that of Great Britain. Photo / NZME
